title: Have you ever been diagnosed with POI by a medical professional?
description: Premature ovarian insufficiency (POI) happens when your ovaries stop working before you reach 40. It affects about 1% of the female population.

options.label: Yes, a medical professional has diagnosed me with POI.
No, I have never been officially diagnosed with POI by a medical professional.
I get other symptoms I believe are related to menopause
I'm not bothered by these symptoms

title: Are you currently using any treatment for your menopausal symptoms?

options.label: I use estrogen, progesterone, and/or testosterone therapy that I can get from a local drug store.
I use treatment without hormones (i.e. non-hormonal therapy).
I am not using any treatment for my menopausal symptoms.
